website_summaries.verdict: Yale's slimmed down touchscreen deadbolt looks much better than previous models, but doesn't introduce any truly new features.
pros: Yale Assure SL is sleek and low-profile
It comes in three finishes and can be upgraded to work with most smart home platforms
cons: In order to upgrade to the smart home platform, you must purchase a $50 network module

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Homekit-compatible deadbolts, with one drawback.
customer_reviews.text: I have three of the Yale Homekit-compatible locks, as well as one each of the Kwikset and Schlage Homekit-compatible locks. The Yale is my favorite of the three. The unit is well-made and attractive. The UI is user-friendly. The only drawback is the software. You can’t create a code that only works for a limited time, like you would want to provide to a babysitter or a housekeeper. I’m hopeful that Yale will add this feature. If they do that, I’ll give them five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Almost a Great Smart Lock
customer_reviews.text: Really good lock. Installation went smoothly and connection with apple home kit was smooth. We have family, friends and service companies who now have controlled access when we are not here. Really like remote view of status of lock. When you are away from the house you can still check to see if door is locked/unlocked; and remotely do either if necessary. My only miff which keeps me from five stars... on the app, you cannot assign a name to specific access code . So I have to keep a special spreadsheet so I know who is assigned what code. Also, there is no e-mail/text notification when an access code is used. Hopefully Yale will fix these flaws soon.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Apple Homekit
customer_reviews.text: Been searching for a smart lock that works with Apple Homekit to keep our smart home under one ecosystem. The instructions are clear and installation was quick (about 15 minutes), and this is coming from someone who never changed locks. We can easily monitor the lock from our phone whether the lock is engaged or not. I've used the keypad a few times already and I was able to open the lock without any instructions (intuitive setup). The lock has small profile and looks great. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J

customer_reviews.title: Low profile, works well
customer_reviews.text: I love having a keyless entry option. I hardly carry a key anymore. This lock has worked well with my HomeKit and I have used the remote unlocking/locking a couple times now with success. My minor gripe is that it take a few tries to get the screen to light up sometimes when I'm returning. I'm not sure if it's when my finger is too dry or wet or cold or what, but sometimes it takes 3-4 touches. It hasn't failed to light up yet and that's really my only gripe. If they had a similar button one with HomeKit integration and without painted only numbers, I would probably choose that over this one next time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Stylish touchpad with great Apple Home Integration... some installation finesse required!
customer_reviews.text: The Yale Assure Lock is a sleek modern looking touch pad deadbolt that easily integrates with Apple Home. I purchased 3 of these locks for each of the doors in my home and installed all 3 with minimal effort. IMPORTANT: ensure that the deadbolt slides to its fully extended position with zero interference from the door frame! Even a small amount of interference will lead to an error. If your doors are like mine, this may require a bit of finesse with the door jam.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Boulden

customer_reviews.title: Unusable with HomeKit app caused firmware corruption
customer_reviews.text: They updated their app in mid 2019 requiring a firmware update. They then admitted that the app update was faulty and causing the firmware to become corrupted and no longer updatable. They promised to resolve the issue but two app updates later, they still have not resolved the firmware issue. Even though the issue was their fault, they are now requiring their customer to purchase a $49 replacement HomeKit module to resolve the issue. This is unacceptable as the lock is not consistently usable with HomeKit as a result and requires a factory reset everything few weeks for it to be recognized by HomeKit.
customer_reviews.author: Hamid K.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Had this lock less than a year. Installed it and it worked fine at first with Homekit. Now it can't find the home network, won't link to the app, and the batteries in the lock drain in a day. Fun thing is the they way it was so poorly is designed the battery compartment and what secures it to the door are breaking now due to use. Good concept, terrible execution, ABSOLUTELY NO SUPPORT. If you're not a software or digital device company don't pretend like you are. I'd stick with something a little less temperamental, with more support and from a company that makes digital products. Yale isn't that company.
customer_reviews.author: Ike Brooker

customer_reviews.title: Wireless access stopped working after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: The wireless functionality suddenly stopped working 2 weeks after installation. Yale customer service has been unhelpful and slow to respond. After a frustrating back and forth with tech support, with their “fixes” consisting of obvious steps that I had already tried multiple times myself, they agreed to ship me a new wireless plugin for the unit. But they dropped the ball and now are telling me the plug-in is on back order and won’t be replaced for some, unspecified time. I’d advise against buying this product. Not worth the hassle and frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Art Vandelay

customer_reviews.title: 2 years later and it's no longer working
customer_reviews.text: I originally liked this product, the app was a little clunky but it worked. Now, two years after purchase, it stopped working one day - wouldn't connect to the app and won't lock. I contacted Yale and tried all of their recommended fixes - all to no avail. Yale stated that, while they are sorry that my $200 lock has failed, they would not do anything about it as they only extend a one year warranty on their products. I am disappointed, and would not recommend this lock or this company to any one seeking a smart home lock. There are better products with better companies that stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: JR303

customer_reviews.title: Nice lock for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice lock for the money. It pairs easily to Smartthings and Amazon Plus. The only thing I don't like is that there is no Yale app for the Zigbee version to allow me to set different lock codes for different people like the Bluetooth version does. I wish it allowed control through Bluetooth as well as Zigbee or they would at least make an app with the same features as the Bluetooth version.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jacks

customer_reviews.title: Constantly Locks my kids outside with no way in
customer_reviews.text: This product has been one of the worst I have ever purchased. The deadbolt does not fully retract 90% of the time locking my kids outside. We have to get into the home through the back, then come through and unlock it from the inside. Vendor suggestions have been simply to replace the batteries with new ones, which we have done multiple times, but it does have some sort of sticking issue.
customer_reviews.author: Agent Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love this smart lock
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy installation. To unlock the door you put in your code and press the check mark. To lock you just put your hand over the entire lock and you will hear and feel the lock moving. I like that you can not only hear a faint ring to it every time you lock it but you can also feel the lock moving. This gives me the assurance that the lock is functioning properly.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work 2 out of 5 times
customer_reviews.text: 2 out of 5 times when I want to unlock it through Homekit the lock says „no response”. I also found the door randomly unlocked. How do I trouble shoot these issues?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Faulty product
customer_reviews.text: Installed on thanksgiving and by mid march it quit opening the deadbolt and just flashing the numbers that form an X...spent 2 hours on the phone with support with someone who could not speak english with zero results. now I am on my 5th e-mail correspondance. Horrible support. Faulty design. Its a common problem...its all over the internet. Just replace it Yale!!
customer_reviews.author: ram22

customer_reviews.title: Never buying another lock again. Thanks yale
customer_reviews.text: I got my lock today and keep in mind I know how to install a lock very well. It took me 5 mins. It’s secure it libes up with the latch smoothly easy Peezey. . I rate this locks sturdiness a 5 out of 5 and gain I am a builder. They will break your door down before breaking this lock. Smart set up another 5 mins . My door know knows when I walk away and it will lock or I walk up and it will lock( tested and I trust it) I can also just tell my phone to unlock it and it will. I’m case I’m away from home and need to let Somone in.
customer_reviews.author: Elias King

customer_reviews.title: Great lock, terrible app
customer_reviews.text: The app is terrible. If you can get past that, its a great lock. They need to hire some actual app developers though.
customer_reviews.author: gnomehole

customer_reviews.title: Great smart lock, with surprisingly good battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with this lock. The installation was fast and easy. The battery life is great. We have use it multiple times since we got it a month ago and the battery level is still in over 90%. The only downside is you can’t name the door codes, and the app notifications don’t tell you which code was used.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. King

customer_reviews.title: bought 2 and both failed less than 6 months after the warranty expired
customer_reviews.text: I spent $400 on 2 of these. The orange module in the top failed in both after about 14 months. I contacted support and they told me I was out of luck since they have a 1 year warranty. I bought a replacement module and it lasted 4 months and also failed. The lock still works from the touch screen but I could have spent a lot less on some other touch pad lock.
customer_reviews.author: wesman

customer_reviews.title: Great lock with good looks value.
customer_reviews.text: Only had a few hours but it is the first HomeKit device that has not missed a single thing while I have been playing with it. Responds every time gave all notifications and triggered other devices. The lock also looks great and has a smaller footprint then I thought it would have. App needs more features but being it’s only been out 6 months and on version 1.0.1 I think it will get better in time.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for subpar product, it should work and connect in under 5min
customer_reviews.text: High hopes smashed. The lock isn’t connecting to the app or HomeKit. It’s just a waste. I have tried for two hours now. I am just returning it and getting August instead. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Roboto

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Install was straight forward. I ran in to problems setting up the master code. I called the help line and he walked me through the process. Works perfectly and looks good too. No hub required with Echo Show.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Cooper

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good lock!
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to install and get up and running! We never worry about having forgotten to lock the door. All we have to do is go to our home app and it tells us the door status.
customer_reviews.author: jke

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: We bought this so that the kids did not have to carry a key with them to school. They love it and we can see what time they get home via the app.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Deadbolt fell apart
customer_reviews.text: Installation went fine until I tried to use the unit and found the deadbolt tolerances were tight, and the deadbolt was jamming against the plate. I removed the whole thing (because the motor isn't strong enough to push past the jam), and the deadbolt literally fell apart in my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and works with homekit!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this smart lock. Easy to set up. I used the app that has video to show you step by step. Quick and everything fits. It works seamlessly with my apple tv and homekit.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with any app
customer_reviews.text: The Zigbee version does not work with any Yale app not with Samsung Home Hub. I am returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Yogi

customer_reviews.title: Frequent breakdowns
customer_reviews.text: This is my most unsuccessful shopping experience. I bought it for a year and it broke down several times. I contacted the manufacturer and replaced the new product. After a period of time, it still broke down. If you don't want to be locked out of the door, don't buy it
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Cute but doesn't function well
customer_reviews.text: Had a really difficult time getting it installed, had to talk with customer support. The Im1 module has never worked so I haven't been able to install on my phone. Basically just works as a code lock. Unfortunate due to the expense...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't work with ZigBee hub
customer_reviews.text: I was able to add the lock to my SmartThings app through a ZigBee hub but it would not operate it. The functionality of the lock is just ok. I bought a Schlage and it works very well and is much easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: verth20

customer_reviews.title: Installs in minutes
customer_reviews.text: This lock installs in minutes, looks nice, and is so convenient. I have made several different codes for family and friends and I never have to worry about being locked out of my home again!
customer_reviews.author: B-Ren

customer_reviews.title: Easy integration with Apple ecosystem
customer_reviews.text: I have a Apple TV 4 hub and this set up and works like a charm from the keypad, iPhone, even my Apple Watch with Siri.
customer_reviews.author: Karthik Srinivasan

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: I use it on my 2 doors, and works great!
customer_reviews.author: MarkSomoTattoo

customer_reviews.title: nice lock
customer_reviews.text: I like how convenient it is to unlock and lock using Siri or the keypad. My only issue is the motor moves a little slowly and sometimes we need to try a few times to get the lock to unlock itself.
customer_reviews.author: "dhonkamp"

customer_reviews.title: Great lock.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and works with Apple Homekit. Every so often the lock will say "jammed" when it locked perfectly fine. Good lock and easy to program.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice lock, easy install
customer_reviews.text: Works great and good value. Works perfectly with Apple Homekit. Easy to install and connected without issue. Only thing is I wish would allow you to create passcodes that worked for a limited time or on a schedule.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reich

customer_reviews.title: Relief
customer_reviews.text: Installed but don’t know about battery life as of yet
customer_reviews.author: Luisa bates

customer_reviews.title: A good smart lock!
customer_reviews.text: The product is very good. Worth every penny your purchase. Good workmanship and works perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos K

customer_reviews.title: Very good!
customer_reviews.text: I am using it on my iOS devices and it’s working great!
customer_reviews.author: John Groover

customer_reviews.title: Love the lock!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, love that it closes the door when we walk out! Live safer! Tim
customer_reviews.author: Tim W. Bauters

customer_reviews.title: Apple HomeKit integration is FAST and installation setup was easy. I do wish there was scheduling so certain ...
customer_reviews.text: Apple HomeKit integration is FAST and installation setup was easy. I do wish there was scheduling so certain codes would only work at certain times and days but other than that, this is the perfect smart lock!
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: Great lock.
customer_reviews.text: Works with Apple’s HomeKit. Easy to install. Good app also.
customer_reviews.author: Erbo

customer_reviews.title: I messed up the master code twice and had to reset it but I love it. It was super simple to install and ...
customer_reviews.text: So I just installed my Yale this weekend. It literally took me less than an hour. Somethings I didn't change was the door hardware. I used my same one and it fit the same. I messed up the master code twice and had to reset it but I love it. It was super simple to install and I'm glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Electronics; poor hardware
customer_reviews.text: Electronics are great it actually works unlike the other brand. no fingerprints no wear off numbers. However, if your stupid enough to install the strike plate with 3/4 inch screws; why buy a 250 lock?? Where is the brass one?
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Schlage Sense is better.
customer_reviews.text: Yale charges for more than 3 users and was not as nice as my Schlage Sense which supports 30 users for free.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Testa

customer_reviews.title: Great product, will definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Put this on my mud room entry, easy enough for my kids to use. Will be purchasing more for additional doors.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

product_meta.title: Yale Assure Lock SL - Key Free Smart Lock with Touchscreen Keypad - Works with Apple HomeKit and Siri, Oil Rubbed Bronze
product_meta.description: Color Name:Oil-Rubbed Bronze| Style:Apple HomeKit EnabledLock and unlock your home without the hassle of keys - enter your 4-8 digit entry code on the touchscreen keypad, use the Apple Home app or simply ask Siri! You'll never need to share a key again, simply create unique entry codes for friends and family and manage them within the Yale Secure app. The lock fits standard doors 1 3/4 inch to 2 1/4 inch thick with face bore holes of 2 1/8 inch and can be installed with just a screwdriver. Environmental - -22F to 140F.
feature_bullets: Lock and unlock your door by asking Siri or with the Apple home app, when you're at home
Access from anywhere when you have an Apple TV (4TH GEN or later) near your front door
Create daily schedules to ensure your door is locked at the same time each day. Adjustable latch
Fits on standard doors 1 3/8 inch to 2 1/4 inch thick with 2 1/8 inch face bore hole
Enter your 4 8 digit pin code on the backlit touchscreen keypad to unlock. Create unique pin codes for friends and family within the Yale secure app

specifications.Included Components: Installation Manual, Secure App Quickstart Guide, Yale Assure Lock SL, Yale iM1 Network Module, Mounting Hardware, Door Template, 4 AA Batteries
specifications.Warranty Description: Lifetime limited warranty on mechanical and finish. 1 Year on electronics
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars212 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
